evidence.text:
Person A: And in Winnipeg, I was helped by the Faintuchs, a Jewish family--
Person A: Yes, naturally, Benji. And when I learned about Judaism and the story of the Jewish people, I felt at peace for the first time since the war. And the more I learn about the religion and the more people I meet -- lovely people such as yourselves - the m ore I know I made the right decision.
Person B: Okay, well you can be a medic or something! Come on up! It'll be funny! Your mom will love the pictures.

Person A: Okay, so you're the medic -- maybe you just jumped out of a copter and you got a fuckin first aid kit and you're patching up this guy's leg here.
Person A: Oh yeah! He's got gangrene.     Holy shit! It's fuckin oozing!
Person B: Don't worry. I have prepared for this moment.
Person B: I want to echo what Marcia said, if that's all right.

Person A: You're like me, Benji.    You're a seeker.
Person B: Yo, that means so much to me, man. I feel like you were some kind of brilliant sage in another life.
